revised_title: Magnetic Properties of Iron and Hysteresis Losses
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the magnetic qualities of various iron specimens and the energy lost due to magnetic hysteresis. They observed that different specimens had varying hysteresis losses and that high permeability did not always imply small hysteresis losses. The authors also discussed a formula proposed by C.P. Steinmetz and compared the results of direct measurements of heat developed in magnetic reversals.
